name: Hotel Rehoboth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed here on a Saturday night, a stop before heading to meetings in D.C.. Our room faced Lake Avenue, and was very large, comfortable, and quiet. Wine and cheese in the lobby seemed like it would be a great place to unwind after a travel day--but we had other plans, with Dogfish Head's pub just across the street.
reviews.title: Great getaway value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was very pleasant, in a room with plenty of sun through the windows and a reasonable selection of warm and cold options. The attendant kept the food replenished and the used dishes cleared in a timely manner.
reviews.title: No complaints/very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again. In fact, we started talking about a summer trip before we'd even left.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Rehoboth for a weekend in February and we enjoyed our stay. The included breakfast was nothing fantastic but it was adequate. We enjoyed the wine, cheese and cookies in the afternoon and the chocolates for turn down service. The room was clean, included amenities were very nice (wifi, tolietries, bottles of water). We had a fridge, coffee maker, fireplace and patio, 2 tvs and 2 armchairs. Everyone we came into contact with was pleasant. it was quiet, but I don't think there were too many other people staying at the hotel that weekend, it seemed quite empty. There were many dinner and bar options within close walking distance, plus one restaurant in the hotel. We felt it was exactly what we expected from reading reviews here and it didn't disapoint at all. It is located quite a few blocks from the boardwalk, but I understand that in the summer they have a shuttle. There wasn't anything open on the boardwalk in Feb. and we enjoy walking so it wasn't a big deal for us but it might be for some.
reviews.title: Valentine's Day Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second time staying at Hotel Rehoboth. This time for Valentine Special, which was well worth it. The hotel is an outstanding value in a community of over priced mediocrity. I won't stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: 2 great stays at Hotel Rehoboth

reviews.text: Although not on the beach front, the Hotel Rehoboth is a good spot for enjoying the best of this classic beach town. The hotel is a few blocks walk from the shore and boardwalk, but situated on the main street in between shops, restaurants and other attractions. The hotel is quite clean, rooms are well-appointed and the atmosphere is quiet and serene. The staff was friendly and attentive and parking was plentiful and free. Of course we visited during the off-season so I'm not sure what the noise level would be like at the height of summer, but I would definitely consider a return visit to this property.
reviews.title: Clean and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending a wonderful 4 day stay at Hotel Rehoboth in June, we just had to return in October to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Again the hotel was "clean" and "quiet", the staff friendly as before, always with a smile on their face to great you as you come and go. Special thank you to “Lakeshia” for making us feel right at home. The wine and cheese hour is nice and relaxing as well as the morning continental breakfast, the food is fresh with a nice variety. The restaurant within the hotel has great food and it's so convenient if you don't want to go out of the hotel to eat and there is a small clothing shop within as well (great for the ladies). This is our special place to lodge when in Rehoboth, try it you will love it too.
reviews.title: "We had to come back"

reviews.text: This was my first booking at the hotel and it was fabulous. Great service, free shuttle to and from beach, easy access to downtown Rehoboth Beach shops and restaurants. The rooms are clean, quite, modern. The only downside, as a wine aficionado, was the quality wine they had at the afternoon cocktail hour. We will DEFINITELY be back!
reviews.title: Great Stay!!!! Great Deal!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rehoboth is a small beach town with shopping outlets, and chain restaurants and motels on the approach highways. This hotel is one of two hotels in the immediate beach area where you can rely on clean rooms and a quieter atmosphere. While the other hotel (Boardwalk Hotel) is older and of victorian decor, Hotel Rehoboth is decorated in a fresh, modern beach decor with upscale accents throughout. Rooms are spacious and are true to promotional photos. The hotel is designed for your comfort and includes extra ammenities such as providing not only an openair shuttle to the beach but also the beach chairs. This is not a childrens type hotel - it is reserved and quiet and definitely meant for relaxation. Room rates reflect its character and ambiance.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: Attended Rehoboth's yearly Jazz Festival in 2011 and 2012 [great event] and stayed here both times. The hotel is sparkling clean and fresh throughout the common spaces & rms (incl grounds & garage). Beds r/comfortable w/fluffy pillows & crisp linen. Room decor is nice. Hsekeeping staff is friendly & accommodating. Hotel restaruant is not to be missed! It's upper mid-priced, w/good food & great cocktails that pack a punch!! Foccaccia bread fresh daily & AWESOME! Free pkng w/outdoor, covered outdoor, & underground spaces (recommended). Great location! Several very good restaurants and shops within the block. Ten minute stroll to the beach. Complimentary afternoon wine & cheese is nice. Complimentary breakfast-OK. All-in-all a very good experience.
reviews.title: GREAT Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been coming to Rehoboth Beach for many years now, staying at the other so-called 'boutique' establishments around town, and the Hotel Rehoboth is my absolute favorite. We've stayed here now four times and it just gets better and better. Check-in went smoothly, as it always does, and when we got to our room we found a note from management welcoming us back and thanking us for our patronage. Nice touch. (On a prior trip, management graciously surprised us with a bottle of champagne and some chocolates for our anniversary). Judging from their online reservations system, the hotel was pretty booked for this long holiday weekend, but it never seemed crowded or noisy anywhere on the premises. Our room was lovely, an oversized double Queen facing Rehoboth Avenue, with wonderfully comfortable beds, fluffy bathrobes and Aveda products. I really appreciate the fact that management takes their No Smoking and No Pets policy very seriously and I hope they continue to do so. All in all, another relaxing out-of-town escape. This IS my getaway-from-it-all hotel in Rehoboth and I look forward to many, many more stays.
reviews.title: My getaway-from-it-all hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Rehoboth is one of the premier hotels in Rehoboth Beach area. Service is always first and with a smile and professional. The hotel sits right on the boardwalk and has great access to the town and the ocean, Within 3 hours of Philadelphia or Washington DC this hotel provides a wonderful place to unwind sit on your deck with a glass of wine and just enjoy. Delawares first boutique hotel combining luxury with a high-value experience at the beach.Within easy walking distance to great dining in town or a short drive to the quaint town of Lewes. Delaware. Plenty of great boutique shops for clothes and the always great outlets. There are very few great hotels in the area and this hotel is at the top of its game.
reviews.title: A beautiful weekend get away right on the ocean
Mid-winter getaway
reviews.text: Stayed here for the first time and will definitely be back. We wanted to visit DogFish Head Brewpub and spend the night within walking distance. This hotel worked out perfectly. The accomodations were outstanding. Extremely clean and high quality. The wine and cheese reception was a nice bonus. Bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. Bed linens and towles were of great quality. Highly recommend staying here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What could be better than visiting the beach? Visiting the beach and staying at Hotel Rehoboth. The staff is great. The rooms are great. ANd then they give you a great breakfast and wine and cheese at 5:00. Even though it was mid winter and not many rooms were occupied, the service was top notch the breakfast was as good as ever - no cutting back.
reviews.title: The best of everthing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are going to Rehoboth Beach, stay at Hotel Rehoboth. The best of everything.
reviews.title: amazing boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night in November as a getaway. The service was great, The hotel is beautiful and quiet during the off season. The wine and cheese hour was a nice touch! The room was large, clean, and well-appointed. We would definitely return!
reviews.title: Quiet Elegance

reviews.text: I just returned from a last minute getaway to Rehoboth Beach for New Year Eve. I stayed at Hotel Rehoboth for the first time and couldn't have been happier. If you ask me, the hotel is both beautiful and convenient. My king room was huge and well decorated, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the service was great. Both the "happy hour" (e.g., wine, cheese, chocolate chip cookies) and breakfast in the morning were outstanding... more than I expected. Finally, both the parking and the wifi were free!
reviews.title: Great NYE Getaway

reviews.text: We have stayed at this location 2 years in a row for a road race. The race is in December so the expectations might not be the same than for a summer stay but while the hotel is not beachfront, it is only a 10min walk to the boardwalk. The rooms are huge, the personnel very amicable and the service is great. We love the free wine and cheese in the common area every evening and the breakfast in the AM is also a great value. The restaurant "Lupe di Mare" in the hotel serves great food but if you're in the mood for something else, the hotel is across from the Dogfish Head brewery and close to everything else.
reviews.title: Charming hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has become a tradition and we will be returning every year!
reviews.title: Thanksgiving getaway

reviews.text: We've had several stays at Hotel Rehoboth, the most recent being an overnight getaway for Thanksgiving. Upon checking into our lovely king room, we found a hand-written 'thank you' note from the hotel, thanking us for our repeat business, and wishing us a Happy Thanksgiving. This was an unexpected, nice touch on their part, and just another reason we'll return again. The rooms are well appointed, always clean, with much appreciated amenities like a breakfast buffet and complimentary wine & cheese 'happy hour'. Staff is generally friendly and helpful. Good location, within walking distance of everything--free parking too.
reviews.title: nothing to complain about

description: Newest 08 luxury hotel located in the heart of Rehoboth Beach-Avenue offering a wealth of complimentary amenities and services including, Deluxe continental breakfast, open air beach shuttle with chairs & towels, turn down service with chocolates, Wine, seasonal beverage with cheese & crackers nightly, outdoor pool, WiFi & broadband internet access, business center, on-site restaurant and much more.
